content.formatted_body:
With fetch, an implementation is supposed to throw an AbortError DOMException when consuming the body if the signal passed to fetch is aborted, however I'm unsure which part of the spec covers this. Does anyone know where this comes from? Thanks, would be super helpful

const ac = new AbortController()
const { signal } = ac

const response = await fetch('https://example.com', {
	signal: signal
})

ac.abort()

await response.text()

content.body:
> <@khafra:matrix.org> With fetch, an implementation is supposed to throw an AbortError DOMException when consuming the body if the signal passed to fetch is aborted, however I'm unsure which part of the spec covers this. Does anyone know where this comes from? Thanks, would be super helpful
> ```js
> const ac = new AbortController()
> const { signal } = ac
> 
> const response = await fetch('https://example.com', {
> 	signal: signal
> })
> 
> ac.abort()
> 
> await response.text()
> ```

https://fetch.spec.whatwg.org/#abort-fetch

content.body: thanks, had an issue where the error was getting swallowed. Got it sorted out now :)
